bio.short: Computer Science student focused on Data Engineering, AI/ML, and Business Analytics.
bio.long:
To me, business challenges are a lot like minesweeper. With the right data, uncertainty becomes navigable - every insight reveals the next strategic move. That's what draws me to Business Analytics: the ability to transform raw data into a competitive edge.

My internships at Kalvium, Acetech Group, and Profisolutions gave me a unique vantage point. I've built the technical frameworks - data pipelines, ML models, automation systems - and I've sat on the other side, using those same tools to shape business strategy. This dual experience helps me speak both languages fluently: translating complex technical work into actionable business outcomes.

I'm actively seeking backend engineering, data science, or AI/ML roles where I can build impactful systems and keep learning.

research.title: Enhanced Neural Style Transfer using VGG-19 and Gram Matrix Computation
research.publication: FMDB Transactions on Sustainable Computing Systems
research.description: Developed and benchmarked VGGram, a Neural Style Transfer model, achieving the highest SSIM of 0.742 and PSNR of 23.8 dB among tested architectures.
